question:
On which of the following grounds the President can remove the chairman of Union Public Service Commission?
1. If he is adjudged an insolvent.
2. If he engages, during his term of office, in any paid employment outside the duties of his office.
3. If he is, in the opinion of the president, unfit to continue in office by reason of infirmity of mind or body.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: The President can remove the chairman of Union Public Service Commission on the following grounds: (1) if he is adjudged an insolvent, (2) if he engages, during his term of office, in any paid employment outside the duties of his office, (3) if he is, in the opinion of the president, unfit to continue in office by reason of infirmity of mind or body.
